Introduce yourself to the respondent and explain the reason for your visit and ask for permission
Please download the data before login
HOUSEHOLD DIETRY DIVERSITY AND SOURCE ASSESMENT
KNOWLEDGE ATTITUDE AND PRACTICES RELATED TO CLIMATE CHANGE: KNOWLEDGE ATTITUDE AND PRACTICES RELATED TO CLIMATE CHANGE
HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF YOUNG ADOLESCENT
The name of head of the household corresponds to the line listing data.
Name of new head of the household
Time of interview: In 24 hours format

The enumerator will read out the consent for understanding of respondent and will mention the purpose of the study and time required to complete the interviews (a separate consent sheet will be provided to the enumerators
IF VERBAL CONSENT IS NOT GIVEN STOP INTERVIEW AND MOVE TO QUESTION# A119 OF THIS SECTION TO RECORD THE OUTCOME OF THE INTERVIEW
Does your HH Have a young adolescents aged 10-15-year?
What language do you usually speak in your household?
Main material of the floor RECORD OBSERVATION
Main material of the roof RECORD OBSERVATION
Main material of the walls RECORD OBSERVATION
What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household?
What is the main source of water used by your household for other purposes such as cooking and hand washing?
Where is that water source located?
In own yard / plot out of dwelling
How long does it take to get to the water source to get water and come back? Number of minutes
Who usually goes to this source to collect water for the household? Is this person under age 15? What sex?
How does that water in the household taste?
Was the water for drinking clear or muddy at the time of collection?
Do you do anything to the water to make it safer to drink?
What do you usually do to make the water safer to drink?
How many rooms in this house are used for sleeping? Number of rooms
Do you own or rent the house that you live in?
Is the cooking usually done in the house, in a separate building, or outdoors?
Separate room used as a kitchen
What type of fuel does your household Mainly use for cooking?
Does your household have? Multiple Response
Do you have your own mobile phone sepretelly?
Does any member of this household own? Multiple Response
What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use?
Note for DC: (If not possible to determine, ask permission to observe the facility)
Flush to unknown place/Not sure/DK where
Do you share this facility with others who are not members of your household?
Do you share this facility only with members of other households that you know, or is the facility open to the use of the general public?
How many households in total use this toilet facility, including your own household?
Does any member of this household own any agricultural land?
How many acres or kanals of agricultural land do members of this household own?
Does this household own any livestock, herds, other farm animals or poultry?
How many of the following animals do the household own?
Does any member of this household have a bank account?
What is total monthly household income of this house?
What is the main source of income of your household?
Do you or your family receive any support in the form of cash or kind? (select as many as apply)
Who provides this support? (select as many as apply)
Was there a time in last month when you or others in your household worried about not having enough food to eat because of a lack of money or other resources?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Still thinking about the last month, was there a time when you or others in your household were unable to eat healthy and nutritious food because of lack of money or other resources?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Was there a time in the last month when you or others in your household ate only a few kinds of foods because of lack of money or other resources?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
In the last month, did you or any household member have to eat some foods that you really did not want to eat because of a lack of resources to obtain other types of food?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Was there a time in last month when you or others in your household had to skip a meal because there was not enough money or other resources to get food?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Still thinking about the last month, was there a time when you or others in your household ate less than you thought you should because of a lack of money or other resources?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Was there a time in last month when your household ran out of food because of a lack of money or other resources?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Was there a time in last month when you or others in your household were hungry but did not eat because there was not enough money or other resources?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Was there a time in last month when you or others in your household went without eating for a whole day because of a lack of money or other resources?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
Foods made from grains (bread, wheat, rice, maize, etc)
White roots and tubers and plantains (potato, sweet potato, etc)
Legumes, Nuts and Seeds (beans, peas, lentils)
Milk and milk products milk, yogurt, cheese, other milk products),
Eat breakfast on days when you are in school
Eat breakfast on days when you are NOT in school?

How often meals (breakfast, lunch or dinner) did you get that were prepared away from home in places such as restaurants, fast food places, food stands, grocery stores or vending machines? (please do not include meals provided as part of school breakfast or school lunch)
When (child name) is worried s/he eat more
(child name) eats more when s/he is mad
When (child name) does something well s/he give him/herself a food treat
When (child name) is sad s/he eats more
When (child name) is happy s/he eats more
When (child name) is bored s/he eats more
(child name) eats between meals even when s/he is not hungry
Does your (child name) now take vitamins?
How many does your (child name) take per week?
Have %1$s ever attended school? If no, probe.
Why (child name) didn’t attend school? [Multiple responses]
Domestic household chores unpaid (e.g. child care, washing etc.)
Child work for household unpaid (e.g. farming, family business)
Child work for cash or food (e.g. casual work, petty trade, begging etc.)
No girl school/no female teacher available
What type of school/college do you attend?
In which calendar year did (child name) last attend school?
What was your age when you stopped attending school/college?
What is the highest class that (child name) has completed? Grade/Class
Did you miss school/college for at least 1 month in the last year except for Corona?
What was the main reason (child name) did not attend school regularly?
Domestic household chores unpaid (e.g. child care, washing etc.)
Child work for household unpaid (e.g. farming, family business)
Child work for cash or food (e.g. casual work, petty trade, begging etc.)
No girl school/no female teacher available
What is the main language of instruction at this school?
During the school year, on how many days in a week did (child name) walk or ride a bicycle to and from school?
During the school year, how long did it usually take for (child name) to get to and from school each day? Add up the time you spend going to and coming home from school.
Is there a source of clean water for drinking at school?
Are there toilets available at school?
On a school day, how many hours on average does (child name) watch TV?
On a school day, how many hours on average does (child name) play video or computer/tablets/mobile phone games or use a computer for something that was not schoolwork?
On a school day how many hours on average does (child name) spend outside before school
On a school day how many hours on average does (child name) spend outside after school before bedtime
On a weekend day during the school year, how many hours on average did (child name) watch TV?
On a weekend day during the school year, how many hours on average did (child name) play video or computer/tablets/mobile phone games or use a computer for something that was not school work?
On a weekend day during the school year, how many hours on average did (child name) spend outside?

Activity during Physical Education Class: During physical education, how often were you running and moving as part of the planned games or activities? (If you didn’t have PE, choose “Almost none of the time”)
A little bit of the time
Don’t have a physical education class

Activity during Recess: During recess, how often were you playing sports, walking, running, or playing active games? (If you sat the whole time or didn’t have a break at School/college, choose “Almost none of the time”)
A little bit of the time
Don’t have a physical education class

During the past week (7 days), on how many days were (child name) physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day? (all the time you spent in activities that increased your heart rate and made you breathe hard)
How many hours on average does (child name) usually watch TV?
How many hours on average did (child name) play video or games on computer/Tablet/Mobile Phone?
How many hours on average did (child name) spend outside?

During the past week (7 days), on how many days were (child name) physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day? (all the time you spent in activities that increased your heart rate and made you breathe hard)
During the weekdays, what time (child name) usually gone to sleep? (AM | PM))
During the weekdays, at what time do you usually wake up in the morning?
During the weekdays, does the child name afternoon nap?
During the weekend days, what time (child name) gone to sleep
During the weekend days, at what time (child name) usually woken up in the morning?
During the weekend days, does the (child name) afternoon nap?
During the school year, how would you rate (child name) sleep quality overall (how well (child name) sleep)?
During the past week, what time (child name) usually gone to sleep?
During the past week, at what time (child name) usually woken up in the morning?
During the past week, does the child name afternoon nap?
During the past week, how would you rate (child name) sleep quality overall (how well (child name) sleep)?
First, please tell me the name of each person who usually lives here, starting with the head of the household. Probe for additional household members.
If age is between 10–15 Years, is this targeted adolescent?
Has (Name) ever attended school (3 years and above)
Does the height measurements differ by >0.6 cm?
Does the weight measurements differ by >.1 kg?
Left middle upper arm circumference measurement #1
Left middle upper arm circumference measurement #2
Does the middle upper arm circumference measurements differ by >.3 cm
Left middle upper arm circumference measurement #3
Since How many years have you been lived in this community/village?
Is your house situated near to a riversid coastline, and low-lying area or on steep incline (hill or mountain)?
Is the house you live-in Insured?
If yes, is it insured against climate related hazards such as hurricane/storm, heavy rain, flooding, or other natural hazards (threats)?
Have you heard the term climate change?
Do you think the following is/are associated with climate change?
Changing weather patterns (more rainfall, hotter periods etc.)
Increase in sea surface temperature and coral Bleaching
Increase in health risks and diseases
Is climate change affecting your community?
Has your community been affected by any of the following over the past 10 years?
Changing weather patterns (more rainfall, hotter periods etc.)
Increase in sea surface temperature and coral Bleaching
Increase in health risks and diseases
What are the main causes of climate change?
Burning fossil fuels such as coals, oils and natural Gases
Transportation such as driving a car, bus or truck (Vehicle emission)
Poor industrial practices (improper waste disposal, factory emission etc.
Climate change is just a natural occurrence
How concerned are you about climate change?
Do you think any of the following are important in helping the community/village, to prevent the impact of climate change?
Build structures to protect living areas/villages
Discourage construction of new settlements near rivers and coastal areas
Relocation of vulnerable settlements near rivers and coast
Increase public awareness of climate change issues

Rank the following climate change issues in order of importance from 1-10 in terms of how you believe that they can affect your community/village. In the ranking, use “1” represents the most important and “10” represents the least important
Changing weather patterns (more rainfall, hotter periods etc.)
Increase in sea surface temperature and coral Bleaching
Increase in health risks and diseases
Who do you think, is mainly responsible for addressing climate change in Pakistan?
Are you interested in finding out more about the impact of climate change in Pakistan?
Have you or the community taken any actions to lessen the impact of climate change?
Which of the following actions have been taken by government to lessen or prevent the impact of climate change in the community?
Reduce use of fossil fuel (coal, oil, natural gas) use 1 Implement energy efficient measures in the industrial and commercial sectors
Increase research and development of renewable energy technologies
Provide support to agriculture sector to improve crop performance/production
Increase public awareness of climate change issues
Early warning systems for health-related impacts
No any action have been taken by govt
Which of the following actions have been taken or can be taken by you or your community/village to lessen or prevent the impact of climate change in the community/village?
No action has been taken by us
If you or your community/village have not taken any action, what has prevented you from taking action to prevent or lessen the impact of climate change on your community/village?
Do not have enough information about climate change
Not aware of what actions can/should be taken
No capacity to take any action
Climate change is not a concern among community
It is not our responsibility to take action
Which are the most effective ways to get information on climate change to your community/village?
Type of Floods HH affected in 2022?
No. of family members affected from floods
Number of HH members died due to floods?
Number of HH members wounded in an incident due to floods or its impacts?
Number of HH members got sick due to floods or its impacts?
Situation of residential House (shelter) after floods
Situation of drinking water facility after floods
Situation of kitchen (if separate) after floods?
Situation of Animal Shed after floods
Was your house accessible through road/street, immediate after floods?
If not, accessible what were obstructions to access
Did your HH displace from your own house to any other place due to flood?
If yes, where your HH displaced?
If displaced, after how many days your HH returned back to your original home.
Do the floods have an impact on schooling of young adolescent?
Young adolescent didn’t go to school
What are/were the main reasons for young adolescent being out of school after the event?
Access is limited du e to damaged bridge/roads
Schools are being used as relief camps
Young adolescents are engaged in earning livelihood
Due to non availability of drinking water in school
Due to non availability of toilet facility in school
Agriculture and Livelihoods and Food Security
Crop of HHs damaged in Acres.
Type of crop damaged in Acres.
Any food stock (grain) of HH damaged due to floods?
If yes, type and volume of grain in mounds
After floods for how many days the food stock sufficient for HH?
Which type of heath facility is available nearest to your HH?
Was health facility remained functional during or after floods?
If no, for how many days health facility remained non-functional?
If health facility remained non-functional, reasons?
What were the main health problems in the community after floods?
Which type of psycho-social or mental health issues community were facing due to floods?
Worrying too much about family livelihoods and other things
Did your HH get any assistance in relief or rehabilitation?
What type of assistance did your HH get?
Have you experienced any of the following non communicable diseases or any other disease or conditions during your life?
Did you seek any care for complications?
Where did you go to seek care for complications?
If no, why you have not been arrived at the health facility?
Health facility was at a long distance
No permission by husband/head of household
Do you have any physical disabilities or long-term health problems?
What type of disability do you have?
Do you have any long-term emotional problems or learning disabilities?
Would other people consider you to have ANY disabilities or long-term health problems, including physical health, emotional, or learning problems
Are you limited in any activities because of ANY disabilities or long-term health problems, including physical health, emotional, or learning problems?
From where you seek medical care from?
How often you had the following in last six months?
Have you ever been scolded by your parents/adults/teachers/Molvi?
Have you ever been beaten by your parents/adults/teachers/Molvi?
To teach you discipline have you been?
Hit with a scale, belt, hanger, hairbrush or hard object
Made to sit in different postures (as chicken etc.)
Do you believe that it is necessary to physically punish a young adolescent in order to bring up/raise a young adolescent ?
How often you wash your hands with soap or detergent or ash/mud/sand
How often you brush your teeth?
What type of brush do you usually use?
Do you smoke or use any type of tobacco or drug? or addict of any thing?
Type of drug or other addiction & frequency of use?
Chewable tobacco (Main Puri, Pan, Gutka, snuff, Naswar, 2100 etc)
What do you think about at what age a girl or boy should get marry?
Do you have a say in choosing your life partner?
